column1: Uchi////4. Fried Milk - I still lament the extinction of the Cracked Black Pepper Sorbet
column2: an impeccably constructed dessert (see my Uchi Austin review for more). The sorbet itself is on Houston's menu
column3: just not the full dish. The fried milk
column4: while not nearly as refreshing as a sorbet
column6: heavy alternative. The toasted milk looks like tongue-in-cheek Rodeo fare
column7: but it tastes eons better than a disgusting batch of Fried Oreos. Crispy on the outside
column9: and tasty throughout. It was by far the best of the three desserts I tried.
